title: Mark Diacono's juicy guide to getting the most out of apple season, including tips for harvesting, storing, and what to make with them
text:
It’s a fair bet that when writing All You Need Is Love, John Lennon didn’t have an apple tree or two in his garden. If he had, he might have written All You Need Is Love and an Apple Press in Autumn, which admittedly scans less well.

If you do have an apple tree in your garden, this October is a bumper year for apples and you might get an abundance of what you asked for, and – if you are not ready for it – you’ll discover that a cracking harvest wasted feels worse than a bad crop. Over the years, I have developed a few strategies for avoiding that sinking feeling.

First, store as many of your favourite varieties as you can. Homegrown apples at their absolute peak are a different world of flavour...
